intro: Ganua palembanica, commonly known as the Palembang ganua, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland areas and is often found near water bodies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture.
